column5: I love using little micro jigs for crappie.  But man are they ever expensive.  Anyone know a good reputable place online to but them?  I'd like to by 30 or 40 so I don't have to worry about it for a long time.
Northland tackle had 20%  off til Dec 3.  https://www.northlandtackle.com/

I don't know how important tungsten is to you? but there are options? https://www.aliexpress.com/item/33032903108.html?spm=a2g0o.detail.1000014.19.4e15272dzYmsCN&gps-id=pcDetailBottomMoreOtherSeller&scm=1007.13338.146400.0&scm_id=1007.13338.146400.0&scm-url=1007.13338.146400.0&pvid=b0594ed9-bb7b-4a74-a0bc-90ccadb6d1e0
Those look like decent little jigs from Ali.  But the expected delivery is 40 to 60 days!  Yikes!
Some of the stuff on Ali gets here pretty quickly considering the distance, other things get shipped on the slow boat?

My Nephew had them for sale at one time. They were sold in a micro jig box with 30 tungsten jigs. 3 different sizes. I will find out if he still has them. He can be found on Facebook under Gremlins jigs I think.

PoolThe link is me. Best to pm me from that page. I sell the kit for $60 or $70 shipped. Pick up can be in Whitby or Cobourg depending on my work schedule. Case is empty on the other side. Three different sizes. 6mm, 5mm, 3mm.

Hopefully in the next two weeks I should have more options. These kits I will not break up. I sat down with 5 other anglers to put these colours and sizes together. Only 8 kits left. I will also have raw tungsten jigs in 5mm and 6mm for sale.

I assume they come with the case and everything shown? Does the price include shipping as well?  I'm in Barrie.  if so, that's a great deal.  I'll have to track you down and maybe get in touch.  I got 6 jigs at Trembleys yesterday.  But it cost me 23 bucks.  I need them for tomorrow though, so I couldn't wait any longer.

I just ordered a 25 pack unpainted 5mm of amazon.ca. They were $26.23 plus shipping. search tungsten shelt as that is the brand name of the jig Figured it would be a decent painting experiment and keep me busy over the holidays waiting for some ice. Last year I bought a few packs of tungsten fly beads from Sail, Cost me a bout $10 a pack for 25 beads. These can slip over the hook and are easy to epoxy to the back of the jig body so I just upgraded a bunch of the old lead heads I had already. Bought the 1/8 and 1/32 size to play with. Both seemed to work fine
Thanks for the idea man!  Sounds decent.
Hopefully in a week or two I'll have my order. I'll beat that price. I just need to wait for duty charges to figure out my final cost.
The kit includes the case and is water tight. 70 bucks is shipped to your door
